channel.title: Adding a custom error

item.title: Adding a custom error
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

Okay, well, I’m just trying to see if I can make a recolor, I know, lame… But, still, just an attempt and I have the correct ints I believe but, I’m getting an error.

Here’s what I have:

if(i == 16666){ class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield"; class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[1]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 61; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 6073; anInt174 = 2604; class8.anInt181 = 1040; class8.anInt190 = 352; class8.anInt198 = 1156; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt169 = 0; class8.anInt194 = -3; class8.anInt165 = 519; class8.anInt200 = 519; class8.anInt188 = -1; class8.anInt164 = -1; class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1; class8.aString170 = "Lava Sword"; class8.aByteArray178 = "Lava Sword".getBytes(); }

Here’s my error:

Class8.java:4712: non-static variable anInt174 cannot be referenced from a stati c context anInt174 = 2604; ^ Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Finished! Press any key to continue . . .

Please help, thanks.

Read full topic
